question: The book of Ecclesiastes states that it is the words of whom (Eccl. 1:1)?
The writer of the book of Ecclesiastes is whose son (Eccl. 1:1)?
The writer of the book of Ecclesiastes states that he rules over what city (Eccl. 1:1)?
The writer of the book of Ecclesiastes says he bears what title (Eccl. 1:1)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) says everything is _____________ (Eccl. 1:2)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) says where does a person toil (Eccl. 1:3)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) complains that labor does not result in ______ (Eccl. 1:3)
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out that what comes and goes (Eccl. 1:4)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out that what remains forever (Eccl. 1:4)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out what activity of the sun that bothers him (Eccl. 1:5)?
To where does the sun hurry (Eccl. 1:5)?
choice: To the center of the sky

question: Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out that the wind blows to what direction (Eccl. 1:6)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out that the wind turns to what direction (Eccl. 1:6)?
What bothers Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) about the wind (Eccl. 1:6)?
choice: It blows from one end of the heaven to the other

question: Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out that the _______ flow into the sea (Eccl. 1:7)?
What bothers Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) about the sea (Eccl. 1:7)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) observes after having looked at the motion of the wind, the streams and sun that everything is ________ (Eccl. 1:8)?
What part of the body does Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) say never has enough (Eccl. 1:8)?
What part of the body does Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) say never is filled (Eccl. 1:8)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out that what never occurs under the sun (Eccl. 1:9)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) points out that what will happen to what has been already done (Eccl. 1:9)?
choice: It will go to the dust

question: Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) complains that there is nothing new where (Eccl. 1:9)?
How does Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) complain about the statement “This is something new” (Eccl. 1:10)?
choice: Something new quickly becomes something old
It is only new to them
It will perish like all the rest
It was already here long ago

question: Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) complains of what is there no remembrance (Eccl. 1:11)?
To what did Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) devote himself (Eccl. 1:13)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) sought to explore things done where (Eccl. 1:13)?
According to Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) what has God laid upon men (Eccl. 1:14)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) claims that everything is a mere chasing after ________ (Eccl. 1:14)
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) says that who has laid a heavy burden on humankind (Eccl. 1:14)?
According to Qohelet’s proverb, what cannot be done to what is lacking (Eccl. 1:15)?
According to Qohelet’s proverb, what cannot be straightened (Eccl. 1:15)?
choice: That which goes round and round

question: What had Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) grown and increased in more than all the kings before him (Eccl. 1:16)?
Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) claims to have grown in wisdom more than who else (Eccl. 1:16)?
choice: All the wise men of the East

question: Qohelet (the writer of Ecclesiastes) concludes that wisdom, madness and folly are all ________ (Eccl. 1:17)?
Qohelet said that he had applied himself to all of the following EXCEPT ________ (Eccl. 1:17)
According to Qohelet’s proverb, what comes with much wisdom (Eccl. 1:18)?
According to Qohelet’s proverb, what brings more grief (Eccl. 1:18)?
What did Qohelet seek to test his heart with (Eccl. 2:1)?
What did Qohelet test his heart with pleasure in order to find out (Eccl. 2:1)?
Qohelet found that testing his heart with pleasure turned out to ________ (Eccl. 2:1)
What did Qohelet conclude about laughter (Eccl. 2:2)
choice: Its pleasure lasted only for a moment

question: Qohelet asked what laughter _________ (Eccl. 2:2).
What did Qohelet use to cheer himself (Eccl. 2:3)?
While Qohelet embraced folly what still guided him (Eccl. 2:3)?
Why did Qohelet embrace folly (Eccl. 2:3)?  He wanted to find ______
What seemed to bother Qohelet in his search for something worthwhile for man to do (Eccl. 2:3)?
choice: It only led to sorrow and grief
It was always blown away like the wind
There were only a few days of life

question: Qohelet pursued all of the following building projects EXCEPT ________ (Eccl. 2:4f).
In pursuing great building projects what kind of trees did Qohelet plant (Eccl. 2:5)?
Who did Qohelet own more herds than (Eccl. 4:7)?
choice: Any one before him in Jerusalem
All the kings of the east

question: What did Qohelet buy both male and female (Eccl. 4:7)?
What did Qohelet own more than anyone else in Jerusalem (Eccl. 2:7)?
What did Qohelet amass (Eccl. 2:8)?
Qohelet accumulated what type of men and women (Eccl. 2:8)?
Qohelet also acquired a _________ and the delights of the heart of man (Eccl. 2:8).
As Qohelet increased in wealth what does he note “stayed with him” (Eccl. 2:9)?
Who did Qohelet become greater than (Eccl. 2:9)?
choice: All the kings of the east

question: Qohelet denied nothing _________ (Eccl. 2:10).
What did Qohelet not refuse to his heart (Eccl. 2:10)?
In pursuing great projects what did Qohelet’s heart take delight (Eccl. 2:10)?
What does Qohelet say was the reward for his labor (Eccl. 2:10)?
choice: To take delight in his work

question: When Qohelet surveyed what his hands had done he concludes all of the following EXCEPT ________ (Eccl. 2:11).
choice: Everything was a chasing after the wind
He was greater than all in Jerusalem
Nothing was gained under the sun

question: When Qohelet surveyed what he had toiled to achieve, he concludes it was like _______ (Eccl. 2:11).
choice: A mighty cedar withered from the roots

question: Qohelet turned his thoughts to consider all of the following EXCEPT ______ (Eccl. 2:12).
Who did Qohelet say could do no more than he had (Eccl. 2:12)?
choice: Those who would follow him in Jerusalem

question: What does Qohelet observe is better than folly (Eccl. 2:13)?
Wisdom is to folly, according to Qohelet, as ________ (Eccl. 2:13).
choice: A tree is to its shadow

question: Where does the fool walk (Eccl. 2:14)?
Where does Qohelet say a wise man’s eyes are (Eccl. 2:14)?
choice: On the path he is walking
In the law of the Lord

question: What overtakes both the sage and the fool (Eccl. 2:15)?
Qohelet complained that he had not _________ by his wisdom (Eccl. 2:15)
choice: Exposed the folly of the fool

question: The fact that the same fate overtook the wise person and the fool led Qohelet to the conclusion that ________ (Eccl. 2:15)
choice: This too was a chasing after the wind

question: Qohelet laments that what will happen to both the wise person and the fool (Eccl. 2:16)?  They will both _________.
choice: Have a hard path to travel

question: Qohelet laments that what will happen to both the wise person and the fool (Eccl. 2:16)?
What did Qohelet hate because the work under the sun was grievous to him (Eccl. 2:17)?
Why did Qohelet hate life (Eccl. 2:17)?
choice: Because it was only under the sun

question: What does Qohelet often parallel with the conclusion “Everything is meaningless” (Eccl. 2:17)?
choice: A candle blown in the wind
A mere pebble on the seashore

question: Why did Qohelet hate everything he had toiled for (Eccl. 2:18)?
choice: It did not bring him pleasure
He did not achieve anything new
He could not take it with him when he died
He must leave them to the one who comes after

question: What did Qohelet know about the one who would follow him that bothered him (Eccl. 2:19)?
choice: Whether he would be just or unjust
Whether he would be a wise person or a fool
Whether he would be kind or stingy
Whether he would be wicked or righteous

question: What had Qohelet poured into his work (Eccl. 2:19)?
Over what did Qohelet’s heart begin to despair (Eccl. 2:20)?
choice: His toilsome labor under the sun
His vineyards and orchards chasing after the wind
His wealth and wisdom under the sun

question: Where was Qohelet’s toilsome labor done (Eccl. 2:20)?
choice: On the mountain of the Lord

question: A person who works with skill must leave it to whom, according to Qohelet (Eccl. 2:21)?
choice: A fool who would squander it
Someone who has not worked for it
The enemy who had sought to destroy him

question: Qohelet lamented that he would have to leave his work which he had done with all of the following EXCEPT _______ (Eccl. 2:21).
Qohelet characterizes a worker’s days as full of __________ (Eccl. 2:23).
choice: Sorrow and chasing after the wind

question: Qohelet says what happens to a worker at night (Eccl. 2:23)?
choice: He must give up all he has worked for

question: Qohelet concludes what is from the hand of God (Eccl. 2:24)?
choice: To find satisfaction in one’s work
To rejoice in the achievements of one’s youth
To enjoy the gifts God has provided

question: Qohelet says a person cannot do any better than all of the following EXCEPT _________ (Eccl. 2:24)?
God gives all of the following to the one who pleases Him EXCEPT ________  (Eccl. 2:26).
To whom does God give the task of gathering for the one who pleases God (Eccl. 2:26)?
To whom does the sinner give all the wealth he has gathered (Eccl. 2:26)?
choice: To the one who pleases God

question: Qohelet concludes that the sinner giving over his wealth to the one pleasing God is also _________ (Eccl. 2:26).
choice: A delight to the hearts of men
The best that can be achieved

question: Where is there a season for every activity?
There is a time to be born and a time to _______ (Eccl. 3:2).
There is a time to plant and a time to _________ (Eccl. 3:2).
There is a time to kill and a time  _______ (Eccl. 3:3).
There is a time to tear down and a time to ______ (Eccl. 3:3).
There is a time to laugh and a time to _____ (Eccl. 3:4).
There is a time to weep and a time to _______ (Eccl. 3:4).
There is a time to embrace and a time to _________ (Eccl. 3:5).
There is a time to search and a time to ________ (Eccl. 3:6).
There is a time to throw away and a time to _______ (Eccl. 3:6).
There is a time to tear and a time to _______ (Eccl. 3:7).
There is a time to speak and a time to _______ (Eccl. 3:7).
There is a time to love and a time to _______ (Eccl. 3:8)
There is a time for peace and a time for ________ (Eccl. 3:8).
Qohelet complains who does not gain from his toil (Eccl. 3:9)?
According to Qohelet, what has God laid upon humankind (Eccl. 3:10)?
When has God made everything beautiful (Eccl. 3:11)?
What has God put into the hearts of humans (Eccl. 3:11)?
What can humans not fathom (Eccl. 3:11)?
Qohelet says there is nothing better than to be what (Eccl. 3:12)?
What is there nothing better to do according to Qohelet (Eccl. 3:12)?
What should everyone find satisfaction in (Eccl. 3:13)?
What is finding satisfaction in one’s toil called by Qohelet (Eccl. 3:13)?
What will happen to what God does (Eccl. 3:14)?
choice: It has its own time and season
It too fades like a flower

question: Why does God make things that endure forever (Eccl. 3:14)?
choice: So people will desire the good
So people will desire what he has given them
So people will realize they will die

question: What will God call to account (Eccl. 3:15)?
According to Qohelet, whatever is ________ (Eccl. 3:15).
choice: Will last only for a season

question: What did Qohelet see in the place of judgment (Eccl. 3:16)?
Where did Qohelet see wickedness (Eccl. 3:16)?
choice: In the palace of the king

question: Qohelet thought in his heart what will happen to both the righteous and the wicked (Eccl. 3:17)?
choice: God will bring them both to judgment
They will both have a time and a season
They will both fear the Lord

question: What does God do so that people will see they are like the animals (Eccl. 3:18)?
Why does God test people (Eccl. 3:18)?
choice: So they may see they are like the animals
So they may learn to do good

question: Whose fate is a man’s like (Eccl. 3:19)?
What do people and the animals share (Eccl. 3:19)?
To where do both the animals and people return (Eccl. 3:20)?
What does Qohelet wonder if it goes down into the earth (Eccl. 3:21)?
What does Qohelet wonder if it goes upward (Eccl. 3:21)?
Qohelet says there is nothing better than to do what (Eccl. 3:22)?
What are people not able to see (Eccl. 3:22)?
choice: What the meaning of life is
When it is their time to depart

question: What is the lot of humankind for Qohelet?
choice: To discover the times and seasons
To seek justice and love mercy

question: Whose tears did Qohelet witness (Eccl. 4:1)?
Who do the oppressed not have (Eccl. 4:1)?
What, does Qohelet observe, was on the side of the oppressors (Eccl. 4:1)?
After seeing oppression who does Qohelet conclude is happier than the living (Eccl. 4:2)?
After seeing oppression who does Qohelet conclude is better than both the living and the dead (Eccl. 4:3)?
choice: Those who have not been yet

question: After seeing oppression who does Qohelet conclude is better than both the living and the dead (Eccl. 4:3)?
choice: Those who have not seen the evil
Those who have closed their eyes to injustice

question: Where has one who has not yet been not seen evil (Eccl. 4:3)?
choice: In the home of the oppressed
In the land of the living

question: What did Qohelet see all people’s labor and achievement spring from (Eccl. 4:4)?
What springs from people’s envy of their neighbor (Eccl. 4:4)?
Qohelet concludes that envy driving achievement is ________ (Eccl. 4:4).
Qohelet concludes that envy driving achievement is ________ (Eccl. 4:4).
Who ruins himself by folding his hands (Eccl. 4:5)?
How does a fool ruin himself (Eccl. 4:5)?
What is one handful with tranquility better than (Eccl. 4:6)?
What is one handful with tranquility better than (Eccl. 4:6)?
choice: Two handfuls with chasing after the wind

question: Who did Qohelet see as involved in meaninglessness (Eccl. 4:8)?
choice: The righteous with no one to help
A king with a fool for a son
A woman with no husband or son
A man with neither son nor brother

question: With what was the one with neither son nor brother not content (Eccl. 4:8)?
What did one toiling with no heir ask himself (Eccl. 4:8)?
choice: Why does my toil not bring rewards?
Why am I depriving myself of enjoyment?
Why am I chasing the wind?

question: Qohelet concludes the one toiling with no heir is ________ (Eccl. 4:8)?
choice: A chasing after dust and ashes
Only chaff blown in the wind

question: Why are two better than one (Eccl. 4:9)?
choice: Because they can accomplish more than double
Because their toil is not in vain
Because they have a good return for their work
Because they can find satisfaction in their work

question: Who does Qohelet say should be pitied (Eccl. 4:10)?
choice: One who has no friend to share his joy with
One who falls with no one to help

question: Who can help the one who falls (Eccl. 4:10)?
What is the result if two lie together (Eccl. 4:11)?
Qohelet asks rhetorically, how one can ________ alone (Eccl. 4:11)?
What can two do that one can not (Eccl. 4:12)?
choice: Bring a witness against an enemy

question: A chord of how many strands is not easily broken (Eccl. 4:12)?
Who is better than an old but foolish king (Eccl. 4:13)?
choice: A woman who fears the Lord

question: A poor but wise youth is better than ________ (Eccl. 4:13)?
choice: A youth who squanders his inheritance

question: Where was the youth who comes to kingship born (Eccl. 4:14)?
Where was the youth who comes to kingship come from (Eccl. 4:14)?
The youth that arose from poverty was the king’s ________ (Eccl. 4:15).
Who were not pleased with the king’s successor (Eccl. 4:16)?
choice: The wise men of the kingdom
Those who were chasing after the wind

question: What should one guard as they go to the house of God (Eccl. 5:1)?
When should one guard their steps (Eccl. 5:1)?
choice: When going to the house of God
When going to the city gate
When going to the king’s palace

question: What should one not offer when going to the house of God (Eccl. 5:1)?
Who do not know that they do wrong (Eccl. 5:1)?
What should one do in going to the house of God rather than offering a sacrifice (Eccl. 5:1)?
Because God is in heaven and we are on earth what response should that have (Eccl. 5:2)?
choice: We should let our words be few
We should remember the poor and needy

question: When approaching God one should not  ______ (Eccl. 5:2).
choice: Think about the wrongs of others
Walk in the path of the sinners

question: When there are many cares what comes (Eccl. 5:3)?
When does the speech of the fool come (Eccl. 5:3)?
choice: When there is no thought before speaking
When the tongue slanders a neighbor
When laziness has run its course

question: What should one do when making a vow to God (Eccl. 5:4)?
choice: Offer sacrifices of a humble heart
Remember that God is in heaven

question: In whom does God have no pleasure (Eccl. 5:4)?
According to Qohelet, what is better than making a vow and not fulfilling it (Eccl. 5:5)?
choice: To offer the sacrifices of a broken heart
Making a vow and fulfill it
To pray and fast in secret

question: Qohelet warns that what should not be allowed to lead a person into sin (Eccl. 5:6)?
To whom should one not protest about a vow (Eccl. 5:6)?
When may God be angry at a person according to Qohelet (Eccl. 5:6)?
choice: If one plots against his neighbor
If one says “My vow was a mistake”
If one says “God will not see”
If one moves the boundary stone of the widow

question: If God is angry with someone he may destroy what (Eccl. 5:6)?
What along with many words does Qohelet consider meaningless (Eccl. 5:7)?
At what should one not be surprised (Eccl. 5:8)?
By whom is one official eyed (Eccl. 5:8)?
From what does the king profit (Eccl. 5:9)?
What is taken from by all (Eccl. 5:9)?
choice: The water from a flowing spring

question: Who is never satisfied with their income (Eccl. 5:10)?
choice: One who sleeps in the harvest

question: What does one who loves money never have enough of (Eccl. 5:10)?
What increases as goods increase (Eccl. 5:11)?
As goods increase what is the only benefit Qohelet mentions (Eccl. 5:11)?
choice: The owners eyes may feast on them
Others may benefit from stealing them
The owners may offer sacrifices in the house of God
The owners do not worry about food or shelter

question: Whose sleep is sweet (Eccl. 5:12)?
Who is permitted no sleep (Eccl. 5:12)?
Qohelet considers hoarding wealth to the harm of its owner as _________ (Eccl. 5:13)?
It is a grievous evil when wealth is lost to misfortune so there is nothing left for whom (Eccl. 5:14)?
How does one come from their mother’s womb (Eccl. 5:15)?
As a person departs from life what can they carry in their hands (Eccl. 5:15)?
It is a grievous evil that a person toils for what (Eccl. 5:16)?
How do people depart (Eccl. 5:16)?
According to Qohelet, a person eats in darks with all of the following EXCEPT ______ (Eccl. 5:17).
What does a person do in frustration, affliction and anger (Eccl. 5:17)?
In what should one find satisfaction (Eccl. 5:18)?
Qohelet says to eat, drink and find satisfaction is good and ________ (Eccl. 5:18)?
Being happy with one’s work is ___________ (Eccl. 5:19)?
Finding satisfaction in toilsome labor is a person’s _________ (Eccl. 5:18)?
What does God keep a person that does not reflect on life occupied with (Eccl. 5:20)?
On what does one occupied with gladness of heart not reflect (Eccl. 5:20)?
Qohelet observes another evil, God gives all of the following to a person EXCEPT _________ without giving the ability to enjoy (Eccl. 6:2).
Qohelet says it is a grievous evil that God gives wealth and possessions to a person but who gets to enjoy them (Eccl. 6:2)?
Qohelet labels God given wealth and possessions enjoyed by a stranger and not the owner as a grievous ________ (Eccl. 6:2).
Qohelet says that one who lives a long time and has many children but does not enjoy his prosperity who is better off than such a one (Eccl. 6:4)?
Qohelet uses the example of a person who lives a long time and has how many children but unable to enjoy his prosperity (Eccl. 6:3)?
Qohelet says a stillborn child is better off than one who cannot enjoy his prosperity or receives what (Eccl. 6:3)?
What comes without meaning and departs in darkness (Eccl. 6:4)?
choice: A warrior who dies in a loosing battle

question: In what does a stillborn child depart (Eccl. 6:4)?
The stillborn child’s _________ is shrouded in darkness (Eccl. 6:4).
What does Qohelet note that a stillborn child never sees (Eccl. 6:5)?
What does a stillborn child have more of than a prosperous person who does not enjoy their prosperity (Eccl. 6:6)?
Qohelet notes that even if people live _______ years and does not enjoy their prosperity it is a problem (Eccl. 6:6).
All people’s efforts is for their __________, according to Qohelet (Eccl. 6:7)?
While all a person’s efforts are for their mouth’s what is never satisfied (Eccl. 6:7)?
Qohelet asks what a poor person gains by knowing what (Eccl. 6:8)?
choice: How to glean in the fields
How to work with enjoyment under the sun
How to conduct himself before others

question: What is better than a roving appetite (Eccl. 6:9)?
What the eye sees is better than ___________ (Eccl. 6:9).
Qohelet concludes a roving appetite is _________ (Eccl. 6:9)
Qohelet concludes a roving appetite is _________ (Eccl. 6:9)
With whom can one not contend (Eccl. 6:10)?
Qohelet observes that whatever exists has already been __________ (Eccl. 6:10).
What becomes less with more words (Eccl. 6:11)?
Like what do people pass through life according to Qohelet (Eccl. 6:12)?
No one can tell what will happen under the sun when (Eccl. 6:12)?
choice: The wind has changed its course

question: What is better than fine perfume (Eccl. 7:1)?
What is a good name better than (Eccl. 7:1)?
What is better than the day of birth (Eccl. 7:1)?
What is better than going to the house of feasting (Eccl. 7:2)? To go to ___________
Going to the house of mourning is better than going to the house of ________ (Eccl. 7:2).
What is the destiny of everyone (Eccl. 7:2)?
What should the living take to heart (Eccl. 7:2)?
choice: That death is the destiny of everyone
All have sinned and fallen short

question: What is better than laughter (Eccl. 7:3)?
What is good for the heart (Eccl. 7:3)?
What is sorrow better than (Eccl. 7:3)?
Where is the heart of the wise (Eccl. 7:4)?
choice: In the house of the widow
In the house that fears the Lord
In the house of the discerning

question: Where is the heart of fools (Eccl. 7:4)?
choice: In the house of the sluggard
In the palace of the king

question: Whose heart is in the house of mourning (Eccl. 7:4)?
What is better than listening to the song of fools (Eccl. 7:5)?
choice: Working in the fields before the harvest
Listening to the song of the widow

question: What is heeding a wise person’s rebuke better than (Eccl. 7:5)?
choice: Feasting in the house of the wicked
Listening to the song of fools
Heeding the call of the sluggard

question: What is like the crackling of thorns under a pot (Eccl. 7:6)?
What is the laughter of fools like (Eccl. 7:6)?
choice: The crackling of thorns under a pot
A gold ring in a pig’s snout

question: What turns a wise person into a fool (Eccl. 7:7)?
What corrupts the heart (Eccl. 7:7)?
What is better than pride (Eccl. 7:8)?
What is patience better than (Eccl. 7:8)?
What is the end of a matter better than (Eccl. 7:8)?
Where does anger reside (Eccl. 7:9)?
choice: In the heart of the wicked
In the mouth of the treacherous

question: People should not let their spirit become quickly ________ (Eccl. 7:9).
What resides in the laps of fools (Eccl. 7:9)?
To ask “Why were the old days better than these?” is not what (Eccl. 7:10)?
What is not a wise question to ask (Eccl. 7:10)?
choice: “Why were the old days better than these?”
“Why does everything return to its beginning?”
“When will justice prevail over the wicked?”

question: What is wisdom like (Eccl. 7:11)?
Who does wisdom benefit (Eccl. 7:11)?
What benefits those who see the sun (Eccl. 7:11)?
What are both wisdom and money (Eccl. 7:12)?
Wisdom and _______ are both shelters (Eccl. 7:12)?
What advantage does wisdom have over money (Eccl. 7:12)?
choice: It guides one on the right path
It brings meaning under the sun
It does not corrupt the heart
It preserves the life of its possessor

question: What preserves the life of its possessor (Eccl. 7:12)?
What are people unable to do with what God has made crooked (Eccl. 7:13)?
What should one be when times are good (Eccl. 7:14)?
When times are bad how should one respond (Eccl. 7:14)?
What has Qohelet seen in his meaningless life (Eccl. 7:15)?
choice: The righteous perishing in his righteousness
The wise being overcome by a fool
The sun rising on the just and unjust
The sluggard reaping the harvest of the diligent

question: What has Qohelet seen in his meaningless life (Eccl. 7:15)?
choice: The wicked offering the sacrifice of the righteous
The wicked living long in his wickedness
The just being oppressed by the wicked
The evil being happy in his iniquity

question: One should not be _________ resulting in one’s own destruction (Eccl. 7:16).
What may be the result of being overrighteous (Eccl. 7:16)?
choice: One may only be chasing the wind

question: People should not be overwicked or a __________ lest they die before their time (Eccl. 7:17).
What may happen to the overwicked (Eccl. 7:17)?
choice: They may die before their time
They may triumph over the righteous
They may have their heart hardened

question: What will the person that fears God avoid (Eccl. 7:18)?
Who will avoid all extremes (Eccl. 7:18)?
choice: The one who fears the Lord

question: A wise person is more powerful than (Eccl. 7:19)?
Who is more powerful than the rulers of ten cities (Eccl. 7:19)?
choice: A person who can control one’s mouth

question: Who is not found on earth (Eccl. 7:20)?
One should not pay attention to everything people say lest one hear what (Eccl. 7:21)?
What does one know in one’s heart (Eccl. 7:22)?
choice: How many times one has cursed
How often one has been a fool

question: What was beyond Qohelet (Eccl. 7:23)?
choice: Attaining to the path of life
Becoming more wealthy than any before him

question: What did Qohelet conclude was most profound and difficult to discover (Eccl. 7:24)?
Qohelet used his mind all of the following ways in his pursuit of wisdom EXCEPT (Eccl. 7:25)?
What aspect of wickedness did Qohelet seek to understand (Eccl. 7:25)?
What aspect of folly did Qohelet seek to understand (Eccl. 7:25)?
What did Qohelet find more bitter than death (Eccl. 7:26)?
choice: The woman who is a snare
The righteous perishing in his righteousness

question: The woman who is a snare has a heart that is a trap and _________ (Eccl. 7:27)?
choice: A mouth as sweet as honey

question: What is the woman who is a snare’s heart like (Eccl. 7:26)?
Who will escape the snare woman (Eccl. 7:26)?
choice: The one who fears the Lord
The one who understands her ways

question: Who will the snaring woman ensnare (Eccl. 7:26)?
How did Qohelet seek to discover the scheme of things (Eccl. 7:27)?
choice: By adding one thing to another
By offering the sacrifices of a broken heart

question: Qohelet said he found one upright man among how many (Eccl. 7:28)?
Who was Qohelet not able to find (Eccl. 7:29)?
How did God make humankind (Eccl. 7:29)?
While God made people upright, what have people gone in search of (Eccl. 7:29)?
What brightens the face of a person (Eccl. 8:1)?
What does a wise person know (Eccl. 8:1)?
What is wisdom’s impact on a person’s face (Eccl. 8:1)?
Why does Qohelet say one should obey the king’s command (Eccl. 8:2)?
choice: Because they have power to make one successful
Because God has ordained the government

question: Because one took an oath before God whose command should be obeyed (Eccl. 8:2)?
Whose presence should one not be in a hurry to leave (Eccl. 8:3)?
What will the king do (Eccl. 8:3)?
For what should a person not stand up (Eccl. 8:3)?
Qohelet says whose word is supreme (Eccl. 8:4)?
What can one not say to the king (Eccl. 8:4)?
choice: Will you judge the case of the widow?
Why do you tax so much?

question: To whom should one not say “What are you doing?” (Eccl. 8:4)?
Who will not come to harm (Eccl. 8:5)?
choice: One who obeys the kings command
One who does the will of God
One who follows the path of wisdom

question: Who know(s) the proper time and procedure (Eccl. 8:6)?
What do the wise know (Eccl. 8:6)?
choice: All that happens under the sun

question: What may weigh heavily on a person (Eccl. 8:6)?
Qohelet says no person knows what (Eccl. 8:7)?
choice: Where wisdom is to be found

question: Over what does a person not have power to contain (Eccl. 8:8)?
Over what day does a person not have power (Eccl. 8:8)?
When is one not discharged (Eccl. 8:8)?
What will not release those that practice it (Eccl. 8:8)?
What will wickedness not do (Eccl. 8:8)?
choice: What is meaningful under the sun
Deliver one on the day of wrath

question: What does a person do to his own hurt (Eccl. 8:9)?
Who did Qohelet see buried in the city that he classified as meaningless (Eccl. 8:10)?
Where did the wicked used to come and go to (Eccl. 8:10)?
Who received praise in the city where they did their activities (Eccl. 8:10)?
When are the people’s hearts filled with schemes (Eccl. 8:11)?
choice: When a sentence for a crime is not quickly carried out

question: When a sentence for a crime is not quickly carried out what impact does that have (Eccl. 8:11)?
choice: People pursue the delights of injustice
The poor are devoured by those in power
The wicked are buried in the king’s tomb
People’s hearts are filled with schemes

question: A wicked person may commit one hundred crimes and still ________ (Eccl. 8:12).
choice: Be buried by the city gate

question: When reflecting on the burial of the wicked, what did Qohelet say the wicked received in the city where they did their evil (Eccl. 8:10)?
While the wicked may live a long time for whom does Qohelet say it will go better (Eccl. 8:12)?
What do the wicked not do (Eccl. 8:13)?
What will the days of the wicked not be like (Eccl. 8:13)?
Whose days will not be like the shadow that lengthens (Eccl. 8:13)?
How does Qohelet classify the wicked getting what the righteous deserve (Eccl. 8:14)?
To what did Qohelet object labeling it as meaningless (Eccl. 8:14)?
choice: When the fool was honored over the wise
When the king received a bribe
When the righteous got what the wicked deserved
When the wicked went to the holy place

question: If one eats and is glad what will accompany him in his work (Eccl. 8:15)?
Qohelet concludes there is nothing better than to do all of the following EXCEPT _________ (Eccl. 8:15).
What did Qohelet’s eyes not see when he was applying his mind to know wisdom (Eccl. 8:16)?
When did Qohelet’s eyes not see sleep, night or day (Eccl. 8:16)?
choice: When he was applying his mind to know wisdom
When he was chasing the wind
When he saw the wicked triumph
When he thought about the death of the righteous

question: When did Qohelet realize no one can comprehend all that goes on under the sun (Eccl. 8:17)?
choice: When he saw the wicked triumphing over the righteous
When he saw all that God had done
When he entered into the house of the LORD
When he considered the death of the righteous

question: Despite all a person’s efforts to _________ one cannot discover meaning (Eccl. 8:17).
When Qohelet saw all that God had done what conclusion did he come to (Eccl. 8:17)?
choice: He could not comprehend what goes on under the sun
He could only bow his head in worship
He knew that he must walk on the way of the righteous
He discovered the fear of the LORD

question: After reflecting, Qohelet concluded who was in God’s hands (Eccl. 9:1)?
choice: Both the righteous and the wicked

question: After reflecting, Qohelet concluded where were the righteous and the wise (Eccl. 9:1)?
What unknowns await people according to Qohelet (Eccl. 9:1)?
What do all share in common (Eccl. 9:2)?
Qohelet says all share a common destiny and includes the righteous and the wicked and what other pair (Eccl. 9:2)?
Qohelet says all share a common destiny and includes the righteous and the wicked and what other pair (Eccl. 9:2)?
choice: Those who sacrifice and those who do not

question: Qohelet says all share a common destiny and includes the righteous and the wicked and what other pair (Eccl. 9:2)?
choice: Those who take oaths and those who do not

question: A common destiny is shared by those who take oaths and _________ (Eccl. 9:2).
choice: Those who refuse to take an oath
Those who object to taking an oath
Those who are afraid to take them

question: Qohelet classifies the fact that everyone faces a common destiny as a(n) ________ (Eccl. 9:3).
What does Qohelet observe the hearts of men are full of (Eccl. 9:3)?
What is in the hearts of people while they live (Eccl. 9:3)?
Whom do people join after life (Eccl. 9:3)?
What do the living have that the dead do not (Eccl. 9:4)?
What is a live dog better than (Eccl. 9:4)?
What is better than a dead lion (Eccl. 9:4)?
According to Qohelet, what do the dead know (Eccl. 9:5)?
What do the living all know (Eccl. 9:5)?
choice: That God holds all things in his hands
That life is but a vapor

question: The dead have no further _________ (Eccl. 9:5).
What will happen to the memory of the dead (Eccl. 9:5)?
choice: The wicked alone will be forgotten

question: Qohelet lists all of the following as vanishing when a person dies EXCEPT __________ (Eccl. 9:6).
The dead will never have part in what happens where (Eccl. 9:6)?
choice: In the land of the living

question: Qohelet recommends that food should be eaten with _________ (Eccl. 9:7).
Qohelet recommends that wine should be drunk with ________ (Eccl. 9:7).
Qohelet observes that what happens in the now (Eccl. 9:7)?
With what does Qohelet say people should always clothe themselves (Eccl. 9:8)?
Where does Qohelet say people should anoint themselves with oil (Eccl. 9:8)?
Qohelet recommends one enjoy who in particular (Eccl. 9:9)?
What does Qohelet say takes place as your lot in life under the sun (Eccl. 9:9)?
Qohelet says that God has given people what kind of life under the sun (Eccl. 9:9)?
What should you do with all your might (Eccl. 9:10)?
choice: Whatever your hands find to do

question: Where is there neither working nor planning (Eccl. 9:10)?
All of the following Qohelet lists as not found in the grave EXCEPT _________ (Eccl. 9:10).
Qohelet has seen that the race is not won by whom (Eccl. 9:11)?
Qohelet has seen that the battle is not won by whom (Eccl. 9:11)?
Qohelet has seen that wealth does not come to whom (Eccl. 9:11)?
Qohelet has seen that what does not come to the learned (Eccl. 9:11)?
What happens to all whether strong, swift or learned (Eccl. 9:11)?
What does no person know (Eccl. 9:12)?
choice: Why some prosper and some are poor

question: By what are people trapped (Eccl. 9:12)?
What are taken in a snare (Eccl. 9:12)?
Who came up against a small city (Eccl. 9:14)?
What did the powerful king build against the small city (Eccl. 9:14)?
Who saved the city by his wisdom (Eccl. 9:15)?
What happened to the poor wise person who saved the small city (Eccl. 9:15)?
Qohelet, after observing the victory of the small city, concluded that wisdom was better than ________ (Eccl. 9:15).
Whose wisdom is despised (Eccl. 9:15)?
Qohelet concludes that wisdom is better than what (Eccl. 9:18)?
Who destroys much good (Eccl. 9:18)?
What is to be the response to the quiet words of the wise (Eccl. 9:17)?
The words of the wise are to be heeded more than ___________ (Eccl. 9:17)?
choice: The shouts of a ruler of fools

question: What gives perfume a bad smell (Eccl. 10:1)?
What outweighs wisdom and honor (Eccl. 10:1)?
What does a little folly out weigh (Eccl. 10:1)?
What direction does the heart of the fool incline (Eccl. 10:2)?
What direction does the heart of the wise incline (Eccl. 10:2)?
When do fools show everyone how stupid they are (Eccl. 10:3)?
choice: When they lie upon their bed
When they walk along a road
When they speak before the king
When they eat the bread of calamity

question: What does a fool lack as he walks along the road (Eccl. 10:3)?
Whose heart inclines to the right (Eccl. 10:2)?
Whose heart inclines to the left (Eccl. 10:2)?
As a fool walks what does he show everyone (Eccl. 10:3)?
choice: How folly leaves one lost in the woods
The end of his way is death

question: What can lay great errors to rest (Eccl. 10:4)?
When a ruler’s anger rises against you what should you not do (Eccl. 10:4)?
When should you not leave your post (Eccl. 10:4)?
choice: When the defense of the city is counting on you
When the enemy is coming over the walls
When the ruler’s anger rises against you

question: Qohelet describes a fool put in a high position as a(n) ________ (Eccl. 10:5).
An error Qohelet has observed is when fools are put in high positions and __________ are put in low positions (Eccl. 10:6)?
Who has Qohelet seen on horseback (Eccl. 10:7)?
Who has Qohelet seen on foot while others were on horseback (Eccl. 10:7)?
Who may fall into a pit (Eccl. 10:8)?
What may bite one breaking through a wall (Eccl. 10:8)?
Who may be bitten by a snake (Eccl. 10:8)?
choice: A fool walking off the path

question: Who may be injured by stones (Eccl. 10:9)?
Who may be endangered by logs (Eccl. 10:9)?
When an axe is dull what is needed (Eccl. 10:10)?
What will bring success (Eccl. 10:10)?
Before what may a snake bite (Eccl. 10:11)?
The words of a wise person are _______ (Eccl. 10:12).
What consumes a fool (Eccl. 10:12)?
choice: The pit he has dug for others

question: Who is consumed by their own lips (Eccl. 10:12)?
What do a fool’s words end in (Eccl. 10:13)?
What does a fool multiply (Eccl. 10:14)?
Who multiplies words (Eccl. 10:14)?
What way does the fool not know (Eccl. 10:15)?
choice: The way to cross the street
How to get up in the morning

question: What wearies a fool (Eccl. 10:15)?
Qohelet offers a woe to the land that has what king of king (Eccl. 10:16).
Qohelet offers a woe to the land whose princes _________ (Eccl. 10:16)?
Qohelet blesses that land whose king _________ (Eccl. 10:17).
Qohelet blesses that land whose princes do not eat for  ___________ (Eccl. 10:17).
Qohelet blesses that land whose princes eat for what purpose (Eccl. 10:17)?
If a person is lazy what sags (Eccl. 10:18)?
If a persons hands are idle what results (Eccl. 10:18)?
What makes life merry (Eccl. 10:19)?
For what is a feast made (Eccl. 10:19)?
What is made for laughter (Eccl. 10:19)?
Who should not be reviled (Eccl. 10:20)?
Who should not be cursed in one’s bedroom (Eccl. 10:20)?
What may carry the words of your cursing (Eccl. 10:20)?
Where is bread cast and found after many days (Eccl. 11:1)?
What is cast on the waters and found after many days (Eccl. 11:1)?
What will happen to bread that has been cast on the water (Eccl. 11:1)?
choice: It will be found after many days
It will disappear like the wind
It will gather water to itself

question: To how many should one give portions (Eccl. 11:2)?
One should give many portions out because what may come upon the land (Eccl. 11:2)?
Because disaster may come on the land what should one do (Eccl. 11:2)?
choice: Cast one’s cares to the wind

question: What pours rain upon the earth (Eccl. 11:3)?
Where will a tree lie (Eccl. 11:3)?
What two directions are listed for the falling of a tree (Eccl. 11:3)?
Who will not plant (Eccl. 11:4)?
choice: The one who has not plowed

question: What will the one watching the wind not do (Eccl. 11:4)?
What will the looking at the clouds not do (Eccl. 11:4)?
Who will not reap (Eccl. 11:4)?
choice: The one waiting for a sunny day

question: Qohelet observes people do not know how a child is formed in the womb nor __________ (Eccl. 11:4).
choice: The way of an eagle in the sky
The course of the sun after it sets

question: Qohelet observes people do not know the path of the wind nor __________ (Eccl. 11:4).
choice: The way of an eagle in the sky
How a snake moves on a rock
How the body is formed in the womb
How the grape is formed on the vine

question: As one cannot know the path of the wind so one cannot understand what (Eccl. 11:5)?
choice: The deeds done under the sun
The way of a man with a maiden

question: Qohelet says that God’s work cannot be understood and he is the __________ (Eccl. 11:5)?
When should seed be sown (Eccl. 11:6)?
What should happen in the evening (Eccl. 11:6)?
choice: One should enjoy a peaceful rest
One’s hands should not be idle

question: Why should one plant seed in the morning and not be idle in the evening (Eccl. 11:6)?
choice: Because the way of the sluggard is paved with thorns
Because one does not know which will succeed
Because the wise know the right time and place

question: What should be done in the morning (Eccl. 11:6)?
Qohelet says light is _________ (Eccl. 11:7)?
What pleases the eyes (Eccl. 11:7)?
choice: To see all the works of one’s Maker

question: What should a person do all the years of their lives (Eccl. 11:8)?
What are to be remembered because they are many (Eccl. 11:8)?
Qohelet says everything to come is ________ (Eccl. 11:8)?
What should one’s heart give them in their youth (Eccl. 11:9)?
What does Qohelet advise the young person (Eccl. 11:9)?
Qohelet advises one follow what ways (Eccl. 11:9)?
In following the ways of one’s heart what should one remember (Eccl. 11:9)?
choice: Now is the time for enjoyment
God will bring one to judgment
Life is meaningless under the sun

question: What should be done to the troubles of one’s body (Eccl. 11:10)?
What should be banished from your heart (Eccl. 11:10)?
Qohelet says vigor and ________ are meaningless (Eccl. 11:10)?
Who is to be remembered in the days of one’s youth (Eccl. 12:1)?
In what particular days is the Creator to be remembered (Eccl. 12:1)?
What kind of days does Qohelet warn are coming (Eccl. 12:1)?
Qohelet warns in years to come one will say (Eccl. 12:1)?
choice: I have no pleasure in them

question: Of what will people say “I find no pleasure in them” (Eccl. 12:1)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, he says all of the following grow dark EXCEPT (Eccl. 12:2)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what does he say happens to the sun and moon (Eccl. 12:2)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what returns after the rain (Eccl. 12:2)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what do the keepers of the house do (Eccl. 12:3)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what trembles (Eccl. 12:3)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age what do strong men do (Eccl. 12:3)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, why do the grinders cease (Eccl. 12:3)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what cease because they are few (Eccl. 12:3)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what grows dim (Eccl. 12:3)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what sound fades (Eccl. 12:4)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what are closed (Eccl. 12:4)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, when do people rise up (Eccl. 12:4)?
choice: At the sound of children playing
At the rising of the sun

question: In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, whose songs grow faint (Eccl. 12:4)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, of what are men afraid (Eccl. 12:5)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what tree blossoms (Eccl. 12:5)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, who drags himself along (Eccl. 12:5)?
In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, what happens to desire (Eccl. 12:5)?
choice: It fades as a flower in the summer
It vanishes as a winter wind
It no longer seeks its goal

question: In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, where does a person go (Eccl. 12:5)?
choice: Returns to the dust from whence one came

question: In Qohelet’s allegory of old age, who goes about in the streets (Eccl. 12:5)?
The Creator is to be remembered before what happens (Eccl. 12:6)?
choice: The rod of one’s strength bends

question: The Creator is to be remembered before what happens (Eccl. 12:6)?
choice: The rod of one’s strength bends

question: The Creator is to be remembered before the pitcher is shattered where (Eccl. 12:6)?
choice: In the hands of the potter

question: The Creator is to be remembered before the wheel is broken where (Eccl. 12:6)?
choice: In the hands of the potter

question: What returns to the ground from whence it came (Eccl. 12:7)?
At death what returns to God (Eccl. 12:7)?
At death where does the spirit go (Eccl. 12:7)?
choice: Returns to God who gave it
It is gathered to the fathers

question: How does Qohelet conclude his allegory of old age (Eccl. 12:8)?
choice: Everything is chasing after the wind
The whole world is in the hands of God

question: What did the Teacher ponder and set in order (Eccl. 12:9)?
Qohelet did all of the following with proverbs EXCEPT ________ (Eccl. 12:9).
What did the wise Teacher search to find out (Eccl. 12:10)?
choice: The beginning and end of things
What pleasures were under the sun

question: Qohelet, the wise teacher, concludes that what he wrote was (Eccl. 12:10) ________.
What are the words of the wise like (Eccl. 12:11)?
What are the words of the wise’s collected sayings like (Eccl. 12:11)?
Who were the collection of sayings given by (Eccl. 12:11)?
Much what wearies the body (Eccl. 12:12)?
Of the making of what is there no end (Eccl. 12:12)?
Qohelet gives the conclusion of the matter saying one should do what (Eccl. 12:13)?
choice: Enjoy life and walk humbly before God
Fear God and keep his commandments

question: Qohelet says what is the whole duty of humans (Eccl. 12:13)?
choice: Enjoy life and walk humbly before God
Fear God and keep his commandments

question: What will God do with every deed (Eccl. 12:14)?
choice: Weigh it on His scales of justice

question: Especially what will be evaluated by God as to whether it is good or evil (Eccl. 12:14)?
